N10/3/GEOGR/BP1/ENG/TZ0/XX




       88105201


GEOGRAPHY
HIGHER LEVEL AND STANDARD LEVEL
PAPER 1

Tuesday 16 November 2010 (afternoon)

1 hour 30 minutes


INSTRUCTIONS TO CANDIDATES

 Do not open this examination paper until instructed to do so.
 Answer two questions.




8810-5201                                                                                          5 pages
                                                           © International Baccalaureate Organization 2010
                                                     –2–                    N10/3/GEOGR/BP1/ENG/TZ0/XX

                        Core Theme: Population, Resources and Development

Answer two questions with all their parts.

Case studies and examples should be used to illustrate answers and, where appropriate, they should be
specifically located. Include well drawn, large, relevant maps, sketches, tables and diagrams as often as
applicable.

1.    The map shows the number, movement and distribution of refugees from the former Yugoslavia
      since 1991.




                               [© UNEP/GRID-Arendal. Reproduced with permission.]




8810-5201
                                                      –3–                   N10/3/GEOGR/BP1/ENG/TZ0/XX

      (a)   Describe the distribution of refugees from the former Yugoslavia since 1991.               [3 marks]

      (b)   Briefly explain three factors that affect the potential mobility of voluntary migrants.    [6 marks]

      (c)   Identify and explain the positive impacts of immigration.                                  [6 marks]

      (d)   Using examples, examine the problems that result from high dependency ratios.             [10 marks]




8810-5201                                                                                             Turn over
                                                            –4–                       N10/3/GEOGR/BP1/ENG/TZ0/XX

2.    The graph below shows the progress made by countries A, B and C towards meeting the Millennium
      Development Goals. The values range from 0 (not on target) to 100 (on target) for each of five
      Human Development Indicators.

                                                             Reduced
                                                              hunger
                                                               100                                 Countries
                                                                90
                                                                                                                  A
                                                                80
                                                                                                                  B
                                                                70
                                                                                                                  C
                                                                60
                                                                50
                                                                40
             Increased primary
                                                                30
            education enrolment                                 20                                  More
                                                                10
                                                                                                 vaccinations




                                 Reduced infant                                Better access to
                                   mortality                                        water

                  [“Trends in sustainable development, Africa Report 2008 & 2009”, Department of Economic
                       and Social Affairs of the United Nations Secretariat, 2008. Reproduced with permission.]


      (a)   Define infant mortality rate.                                                                              [2 marks]

      (b)   State which country is closest to reaching the target for infant mortality rate.                           [1 mark]

      (c)   Identify which of the three countries is most developed and justify your choice.                           [4 marks]

      (d)   Using located examples, explain how a lack of basic needs (food, shelter,
            and safe water) creates problems for some people.                                                          [8 marks]

      (e)   With reference to a country you have studied, examine how trade, aid and
            indebtedness have affected its economic development.                                                      [10 marks]




8810-5201
                                                             –5–                       N10/3/GEOGR/BP1/ENG/TZ0/XX

3.    The map shows two alternative trade flows for a commodity produced in South America and consumed
      in North America.


                                                                          % of price paid by consumer:

                                                                                             Store 40

                                                                          Store 16           Distributor 10

                                                                         Packaging 21           Packaging 17

                     Consumers                                             Trader 43               Trader 20

                                                                        Co-operative 20        Farm owner 11

                                                                                              Farm worker 2
                                   Producers




       [Source: http://www.canunite.org/sites/default/files/images/canpage_images/63_CAN_Trade_Innovations_colormap_10.jpg]


      (a)    Describe the differences between the two trade flows shown.                                              [3 marks]

      (b)    Explain two main features of the global pattern of food trade.                                       [3+3 marks]

      (c)    Discuss how changes in technology have affected the production of one resource
             other than food.                                                                                         [6 marks]

      (d)    “Malthusian views of the relationship between population and food remain
             relevant today.” Discuss this statement.                                                                [10 marks]
